channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Mercury could hit 85F from Friday making Britain hotter than IBIZA
item.description: Though the week may have started downcast and gloomy for many, Brits can look forward to the weekend as the sun makes a welcome return on Friday.

item.title: Boris Johnson poised to RELAX train and bus restrictions to get UK back to work
item.description: The Prime Minister is expected to deliver a press conference in Downing Street tomorrow afternoon when he will say it is time for people to go back to their workplaces.

item.title: Covid-19 intensive care mortality rates have fallen by a THIRD since the start of pandemic
item.description: Analysis of more than 20 international studies by the University of Bristol shows the number of patients dying from Covid-19 in ICU fell has plummeted by a third since March.

item.title: Red Bull 'fires' top US executives 'who pushed for diversity and inclusion'
item.description: North America chief executive Stefan Kozak, left, and North America president and chief marketing officer Amy Taylor, right, were let go, the company said Tuesday.

item.title: Black man claims he was racially profiled by police who put him in handcuffs during stop-and-search
item.description: Video which was uploaded to social media shows Jared Yankiah, 24, being handcuffed and held against a wall by officers in Anfield, Liverpool on July 1.

item.title: Jofra Archer excluded from England squad after 'breach of team's bio-secure protocols'
item.description: Jofra Archer was sensationally left out of the second Test against West Indies at Old Trafford after breaking coronavirus protocols by apparently making an unauthorised detour to visit his home.

item.title: Shamima Begum CAN return to Britain to battle for her right to remain
item.description: Begum - one of three east London schoolgirls who travelled to Syria to join ISIS - lost her UK passport after she was found, nine months pregnant, in a Syrian refugee camp in February last year.

item.title: Official Black Country flag is BANNED by the fire service for fears it is linked to slavery
item.description: The black, white and red design became the official flag of the Black Country, the birthplace of the Industrial Revolution, in 2012 after schoolgirl Gracie Sheppard won a competition to design it.

item.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard at High Court for day eight of trial
item.description: Johnny Depp, 57, is suing The Sun publisher over an April 2018 article which alleged he was violent towards ex-wife Amber Heard, 34, during their tumultuous relationship.

item.title: IKEA launch vegan alternative to their famous meatballs made from pea protein
item.description: The Swedish furniture giant will sell the plant-based version of the popular treat for £2.75 for a 500g bag in its food halls across the UK from 3rd August and in restaurants from 26th October.

item.title: Pampered pooches: Dog owner builds a mini stairlift to help her elderly pets climb the stairs
item.description: Sonya Karimi, 31, built a mini stairlift for her pugs George, 13, and Bodhi, 10, plus her Boston terrier Sam, 10. Her younger pug Emery, four, also likes to hop into ride up and down the stairs in New Orleans.

item.title: Egypt demands to know whether Ethiopia is deliberately filling its £3bn dam
item.description: Pictures taken on July 12 showed water backing up behind the hydroelectric Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam, prompting questions over whether Ethiopia has closed the dam's gates.

item.title: Personal stylist reveals the designer handbags predicted to increase in value
item.description: Abbey Booth, owner of personal styling business Stories With Clothes in Buckinghamshire, told FEMAIL that designer bags are the utlimate safe investment because they're always in demand.

item.title: Having a royal patron brings no noticeable boost to a charity's income, study finds
item.description: A study of Britain's charities by Giving Evidence said it 'could not find any evidence,' that having a patron from the royal family helps to boost its annual revenue.

item.title: Egyptian prank show is accused of animal cruelty
item.description: The Mahadesh Fahem Haga show has been dubbed 'cruel' by animal rights organisation PETA. The Egyptian programme showed a monkey dangled from a chain around its neck.

item.title: Daily death toll 'is being INFLATED and fewer than 40 people are dying per day in the UK'
item.description: Dr Jason Oke and Professor Carl Heneghan at Oxford University's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine said PHE's death counts 'vary substantially from day to day'.

item.title: Pawsome! Pit bull is determined to climb pool ladder so he can jump in for a quick dip
item.description: Max the pit bull terrier was determined to climb a pool ladder so he could join his owner for a dip in Long Branch, New Jersey. Footage of the pooch's dive was taken at his owner's mother's house.

item.title: Julian Lewis accuses PM of 'improper' bid to seize control of security watchdog
item.description: Julian Lewis hit out after No10 ejected him from the Tory party in revenge for his dramatic ambush of Chris Grayling last night, which saw him installed as chair of the Intelligence and Security Committee.

item.title: Woman's Tinder girlfriend becomes husband after revealing he was born the wrong gender pre-wedding
item.description: Chase and Elan Storey, from Calgary, Alberta, both identified as women when they started their relationship in 2017, but tied the knot as husband and wife last year.

item.title: Moment driver moves into left turn lane but changes mind and heads straight into oncoming traffic
item.description: A driver shocked other motorists when they drove on the wrong side of the road after missing a turn in Palestine, Texas, on Sunday. The driver narrowly avoided a car in the lane ahead.

item.title: London sees EIGHTH murder in two weeks
item.description: Police found the victim in Harlesden, Brent at 3am this morning. This is the latest in a string of murders across the Capital in the wake of lockdown restrictions being eased.

item.title: Leicester finds out TODAY if it is coming out of lockdown after more than two weeks
item.description: Sir Peter Soulsby said he expected to hear from Matt Hancock this afternoon on whether restrictions will be lifted for Leicester, which was the first place in the country to have lockdown re-imposed on June 30.

item.title: Rishi Sunak is pictured wearing face mask that 'acts like a jet' to SPREAD Covid
item.description: The Chancellor posted an image of himself wearing a grey mask fitted with a valve carrying a Pret a Manger bag, telling his followers he was 'making the most' of the coffee chain's price cut.

item.title: China AVOIDS coronavirus economic recession as its second-quarter GDP grows 3.2 per cent
item.description: The country's economy bounced back to growth between April and June after a deep slump at the start of the year as China's GDP sees a 3.2 per cent year-on-year increase in the second quarter.

item.title: Man, 31, is arrested over woman's death after she is found with fatal injuries next to burning car
item.description: Officers were called to the southbound carriageway of the A21 near the exit for Tonbridge, Kent, at 2.34am. A 31-year-old man from London has been arrested in connection with her death.

item.title: Nobel laureates call for healthy volunteers to be infected with coronavirus for vaccine trials
item.description: The controversial 'challenge trials' could rapidly accelerate vaccine studies which are struggling to recruit volunteers because of falling infection rates, the international group say.

item.title: Bizarre moment 'bullying' refuse workers surround couple's car with 11 bins
item.description: Footage from outside a home in Chadderton, Oldham on Wednesday morning shows the three workers walking down the side of the house as one of them points and says 'Block that f***ing car in'.

item.title: Author reveals James Bond's London address
item.description: William Boyd, who wrote the Bond continuation novel Solo, believes creator Ian Fleming imagined his character lived in Wellington Square, Chelsea.

item.title: Detectives launch murder probe after man in his 30s is stabbed to death in leafy suburb
item.description: Emergency services were called to the property in Redditch, Worcestershire, around 9.30pm last night. The victim was pronounced dead at the scene and nobody has yet been arrested.

item.title: Joe Biden, Elon Musk, Bill Gates and Barack Obama all have their Twitter accounts HACKED
item.description: Twitter has been hit by one of the largest social media hacks ever, as attackers took control of high-profile accounts including politicians and billionaires before trying to dupe users in a Bitcoin scam.

item.title: Duchess of Cornwall pays tribute to the Chelsea Pensioners who died of Covid-19
item.description: Camilla, 72, looked elegant in a white coat dress and matching gloves as she arrived at the Royal Hospital Chelsea to deliver a speech and inspect the 30 pensioners on parade.

item.title: The VIP dining spots with tables you can book TONIGHT
item.description: FEMAIL has searched for reservations at VIP dining spots over the next few weeks and shared some of the star finds - including availability for The Ritz's hugely popular afternoon tea this Saturday.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES sees a moment of merriment during a routine PMQs
item.description: HENRY DEEDES Sir Ed Davey's face was a picture. A whirling, twirling swirl of yee-haw, whoop-dee-doo delight.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell 'secretly married to protect her money' it is claimed
item.description: An acquaintance of Ghislaine Maxwell believes she secretly married to protect her fortune. The British socialite is thought to be worth around $10 million and living off a trust fund.

item.title: Nelson Mandela's daughter had coronavirus
item.description: Zindzi Mandela, the daughter of South African anti-apartheid leader Nelson Mandela, died aged 59 in Johannesburg on Monday. Her son revealed she tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Celebrity hairdresser Nicky Clarke says he's had no complaints about additional fee to cover PPE
item.description: Clarke, 62, revealed on GMB that he's charging a £5 fee to cover the costs of PPE at his London salons, in a debate about businesses increasing prices to boost profits after lockdown.

item.title: Queen Letizia of Spain put to pay tribute to country's coronavirus victims
item.description: The Queenl, 47, joined her husband 52, and daughters Princess Leonor, 14, and Princess Sofia, 12, in masks and wore dark colours to pay their respects at the royal palace in Madrid.

item.title: Princess Eugenie virtually visits charity which creates gardens for NHS spinal centres
item.description: Princess Eugenie, 30, has taken to Instagram to reveal that she virtually visited national charity Horatio's Garden last month - which creates gardens for NHS spinal centres.

item.title: Arab Mars probe faces further delays due to severe weather in Japan
item.description: The probe, named Al-Amal, was designed and built by the United Arab Emirates over the past six years to stimulate the science sector in the Arab state.

item.title: Siberia´s heatwave `effectively impossible´ without climate change
item.description: On June 20, Siberia recorded an all-time high temperature of 38°C (100°F) at Verkhoyansk monitoring station. June was 5°C warmer on average than it was historically.

item.title: Number of people employed has plunged by 650,000 since coronvirus chaos erupted
item.description: Some 650,000 fewer are on the payroll than before the crisis, according to official figures.

item.title: Dental nurse whose nose was broken by boyfriend helped convict him after secretly recording threat
item.description: Tiana Crawford, 20, was assaulted by Dontae O'Connor, 21, in a violent attack but he lied to police she had injured herself. It prompted her to tape their next phone conversation, where he threatened her

item.title: Does spending £180 on Rishi's smart cup make you a mug?
item.description: Rishi Sunak was reportedly gifted a £180 Ember 'smart' travel mug by his wife. Jenny Wood gives her verdict on the high-tech mug and other smart bottles available in the UK.

item.title: Most popular properties for sale since stamp duty cut revealed
item.description: All of the most popular homes for sale on property website Zoopla cost between £300,000 and £500,000 and are spread across the country.

item.title: Schoolboy, 5, left in tears after thieves steal entire contents of his honesty box stall
item.description: Harry Clare, 5, was left distraught after he discovered his stall had been cleared out. The schoolboy has since received messages of support from around the globe

item.title: Number of online paedophiles triples to 300,000
item.description: The Internet Watch Foundation said it received some 44,000 reports between March 23 and July 9, compared to 29,000 during the same period last year.

item.title: Stars twice the size of the Sun produced the majority of carbon in the Milky Way
item.description: Astronomers from the US and UK including the University of Warwick, studied star clusters throughout the Milky Way to track down the main sources of carbon.

item.title: Colombian cartels execute people who break lockdown as soaring coronavirus deaths hit 5,814
item.description: At least nine people have been assassinated in recent months for either refusing to abide by the restrictions or opposing them. Pictured: Soldiers patrol the streets in Colombian capital Bogota.

item.title: Up to two thirds of elderly were discharged from hospitals to care homes without a Covid-19 test
item.description: NHS England data shows at least 25,000 patients were moved from hospitals to care homes between March 17 and April 15. But 16,000 weren't tested to ensure they were Covid-free, it has been claimed.

item.title: 'Come and get me!': Brazen fugitive taunts police in Instagram video
item.description: Cody Lowndes, 21, who is at the centre of a manhunt, escaped police at Tameside General Hospital in Greater Manchester last Saturday and has been on the run since.

item.title: Family of tech millionaire beg the NYPD to find his 'evil' killer after he was dismembered by hitman
item.description: Fahim Saleh's limbs and head were found cut from his torso by his sister when she arrived at the entrepreneur's apartment on East Houston in Manhattan's Lower East Side on Tuesday.

item.title: 140 including a Moscow politician arrested during protests Putin's constitutional reforms
item.description: The OVD-Info monitor group, which tracks arrests at political protests, said 142 people were detained last night in Moscow. Many people including journalists were put in police vehicles.

item.title: Bristol council crew removes sculpture of protester from plinth where Edward Colston statue stood
item.description: A statue of slave trader Edward Colston was pulled down and dumped in Bristol Harbour during Black Lives Matter protests last month.

item.title: Prince Andrew's official website is quietly taken down - but Duke's Twitter account remains active
item.description: The Duke of York's Twitter and Instagram accounts remain active, however no posts have been shared since he stepped back from his public duties in November 2019.

item.title: Duck with arrow through head rescued months after being shot
item.description: The mallard (pictured) miraculously survived after being shot by thugs with a crossbow on the river Radbuza in the city of Pilsen in the Czech Republic.

item.title: Jamie Oliver's wife Jools reveals she suffered another miscarriage during lockdown
item.description: The mother-of-five, 46, candidly revealed that since giving birth to her son River in 2016, she has suffered three miscarriages, one of which was just weeks earlier.

item.title: Brainteaser challenges puzzlers to find the BBQ amongst the burgers, hot dogs, steaks and ribs
item.description: The busy graphic, created by US-based food company Seriously Smoked, challenges puzzlers to spot the BBQ in the ocean of burgers, hot dogs, steaks and ribs.

item.title: Intimate documentary dives into the life and loves of Princess Margaret, the 'Rebel Princess'
item.description: The second episode of the Smithsonian channel's show Private Lives of Windsors focuses on Princess Margaret's trajectory as a royal rebel and her relationship with the press.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV: The hero conservationists ready to save Asia's bears
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Despite the cute title, it took a strong stomach to endure the scenes of animal cruelty in Bears About The House (BBC2).

item.title: Madonna's 'family reunion' with ex Guy Ritchie at art gallery
item.description: The pop icon, 61, and the filmmaker, 51, seemed to have put their rocky past behind them as they enjoyed a reunion at an art gallery with their families in London earlier this month.

item.title: Fascinating We're The Russos footage from a trip on the world's highest railway in Tibet
item.description: The video was shot by Joe and Kait Russo as they travelled by train to Lhasa in Tibet on a line so lofty that it left Joe with severe headaches - until the oxygen arrived.

item.title: Harry and Meghan's carbon footprint could be 26 times more than average Briton
item.description: The new analysis came after the couple were spotted in Los Angeles getting into a gas-guzzling SUV dubbed 'as far from environmentally-friendly as you can get' because it does 14 miles per gallon.

item.title: UK banks propose 'student loans style' scheme to help businesses pay back £46bn Covid debt
item.description: Banking lobby group TheCityUK has said recapitalisation of these loans is 'essential' to protect SMEs and businesses will need help tackling debt which could 'hold them back'.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Doorman at Vogue gets fired for 'racist' snub to editor Edward Enninful
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Vogue editor Edward Enninful was refused entry to Vogue House in Mayfair by a security guard who apparently failed to recognise him.

item.title: Diddy invites Nick Cannon to his Revolt TV network after he was fired by ViacomCBS
item.description: Charlamagne tha God has said Nick Cannon's firing from ViacomCBS has proved 'Jews have the power' after the actor was terminated on Tuesday for making anti-Semitic comments.

item.title: Bradford City footballer handcuffed during stop-and-search
item.description: Ben Richards-Everton was pulled over by police and hand cuffed while they searched his Range Rover in Sutton Coldfied searching for weapons and drugs but found no illegal items.

item.title: 'General's lockdown trysts': Army probe claims married father-of-three broke lockdown to see lover
item.description: Married father-of-three Major General Rupert Jones, the son of a Falklands war hero, was in charge of the UK military's response to the coronavirus pandemic abroad.
item.media:credit: Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: The shocking tweaks that add HUNDREDS of calories to your meals revealed
item.description: Experts have revealed the shocking tweaks that can add hundreds of calories to your meals, and why a healthy-looking dish isn't always going to be good for your waistline.

item.title: One in three firms are preparing to lay off staff before furlough ends in October
item.description: The threat of mass lay-offs comes ahead of figures which are today expected to show the biggest fall in employment since the 1980s.

item.title: Ex husband of footballer Cesc Fabregas's wife collapses and wails in dock as he is jailed
item.description: Elie Taktouk, 45, is said to have wailed for '25 minutes' while he was sentenced after ignoring court orders in his divorce battle with Daniella Semaan, reports The Sun.

item.title: Around 190,000 people missed vital heart ultrasounds in England during lockdown
item.description: The British Heart Foundation said four out of 10 heart disease patients had had a planned test, surgery or procedure cancelled because of reduced hospital capacity during the Covid-19 crisis.

item.title: Labour set to formally apologise to seven antisemitism whistleblowers who appeared in BBC Panorama
item.description: The party will apologise as part of a settlement with whistleblowers who took legal action against the Labour party after claiming they were 'defamed' for appearing on BBC's Is Labour Anti-Semitic?

item.title: MICK HUME At last, a BBC boss has admitted stars make a mockery of being impartial with social media
item.description: MICK HUME: Senior BBC journalists have become 'addicted' to Twitter, according to the Corporation's own director of editorial policy and standards, David Jordan.

item.title: Boris Johnson is proposing to move House of Commons to YORK
item.description: In a letter, the PM says that locations outside London should be considered as a review is under way on how to handle the repair works at Parliament,

item.title: The idyllic holiday island named after XXXX is on sale for $25m and boasts palm-fringed beaches
item.description: Award-winning Pumpkin Island, located 14km from Yeppoon in central Queensland, is on the market for the second time since 1961.

item.title: Donald Trump demotes his campaign manager Brad Parscale less than 4 months before the election
item.description: Parscale will be replaced by Bill Stepien, deputy campaign manager and a veteran Republican political operative, Trump announced on Twitter on Wednesday evening.

item.title: Police 'close to identifying caller who Madeleine McCann suspect spoke to on the night she vanished
item.description: Officers are said to be following up 16 leads from members of the public after an appeal on a German TV show - similar to CrimeWatch - according to the show's presenter Rudi Cerne.

item.title: Eerie animation shows how the world went from zero to 10 MILLION
item.description: An animation made by data visualization group Global Stats reveals how coronavirus outbreaks bloomed across the globe as the pandemic exploded past 10 million deaths over just six months.

item.title: Police arrest man in his 40s after ex-fiancé of EastEnders star Gillian Taylforth was shot
item.description: Dave Fairbairn, 64, was shot in the stomach on Sunday, July 5 after reportedly confronting a group of people.

item.title: Mummy blogger Constance Hall, 36, reveals how she transformed her son's bedroom
item.description: Mummy blogger Constance Hall has transformed her son's new bedroom into a 'starry night' space that features a van Gogh inspired mural she painted herself.

item.title: Mother and daughter are killed in horror crash in Wales
item.description: The mother and daughter died after their VW Polo was involved in a collision with a truck between Gardolbenmaen and Penmorfa in North Wales at around 3.30pm yesterday.

item.title: Fitness trainer shares moves you can do in the bathroom, kitchen and a CAR to tone your entire body
item.description: An American Pilates instructor has shared the simple exercises you can do while brushing your teeth, standing next to a bed and on a road trip to tone your entire body on social media.

item.title: The hellish world of prisoner 02879-509: PAUL BRACCHI examines Ghislaine's Maxwell's new life
item.description: Could there be a harsher introduction to life inside the Metropolitan Detention Center - a bleak high-rise concrete fortress in the Brooklyn district of New York - for Ghislaine Maxwell?

item.title: Navy tests the use of NETS to snare migrants in the Channel as record numbers cross illegally
item.description: Military ships worked with UK Border Force in May and June, trying out tactics to deploy against small boats crossing from France.

item.title: Donald Trump is inundated with barrage of polls that show him trailing Joe Biden
item.description: Trump was trailing Biden in all four national polls released Wednesday, while also trailing in a host of critical battleground states.

item.title: Smiling Amber Heard arrives back at her London hotel after seventh day of High Court libel trail
item.description: Wearing red-lipstick and with her hair in plaits, the 34-year-old actress looked happy as she retired to her London hotel for the night, as her ex's libel case against The Sun continues.

item.title: Britain is 'Europe's No 1 target' for infiltration by China's Communist Party, expert warns
item.description: Author Mareike Ohlberg, who has written about the underhand tactics of the country's Communist Party, said attempts to groom leading figures in business and politics were at an advanced stage.

item.title: Expert reveals the four different financial personalities - and how to sort your finances out
item.description: A financial expert has revealed the four different financial personalities - and how you can sort your money out whatever your type. Melissa Browne, from Sydney, said knowing your type hugely helps.

item.title: Royal Navy nuclear submarine had near-miss with car ferry packed full of passengers
item.description: The ship, carrying 282 people, was sailing between Belfast and Cainryan in south-west Scotland, when the terrifying incident unfolded in the North Channel on November 6, 2018.

item.title: Fifth of Brits say they aren't as close with their friends or lovers after lockdown
item.description: A fifth of 70,000 respondents said their friendships have gotten worse during lockdown, according to University College London, while 18% said the same was true of their love life.

item.title: Sony may produce DOUBLE the amount of PlayStation 5s to meet added demand during COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: According to a report from Japanese daily, Nikkei, the gaming giant will double its production of the next-generation console which originally planned to shop between 5 to 6 million units by March 2021.

item.title: Breastplate worn by Helen Mirren's in Excalibur expected to fetch $22,000 at auction
item.description: Prop Store will hold the Entertainment Memorabilia Live Auction on August 26 and 27. Over 850 lots of TV and film memorabilia will be auctioned in Los Angeles, California.

item.title: Earlier lockdowns do cut Covid-19 outbreaks quicker, study shows
item.description: Britain took 45 days to implement social distancing after the first confirmed case. Incidence shrunk by 17% as a result, compared to Andorra which did so after 10 days and it dropped 36%.

item.title: Who'll find love on our virtual date? This week it's Pam, 34, and Gary, 30,
item.description: Every week during lockdown, FEMAIL sends two UK singletons on a virtual blind date and asks them to report back. Pam, 34, and Gary, 30, shared their experience.

item.title: Should you dump someone over their politics? As Jodie Comer is slammed for dating a Republican
item.description: Social media users have blasted Jodie Comer for dating James Burke who is a Republican. Tanya Gold and Flora Gill debate if the British actress should end her relationship.

item.title: Narcissists are more likely to be high energy workers and be viewed positively by their supervisors
item.description: Most people would take it as an insult if they were called a narcissist, but the label could be a desirable quality for employers.

item.title: Face of a man who lived 500 years ago in lost city of Poland is revealed with 3D technology
item.description: He may have been a merchant or a craftsman, but one thing is sure is that experts now know what a man looked like when he lived in a lost city of Poland during the 16th century.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: Yes, we're in a hole, Rishi. But don't be even more of a Corbynista than Jeremy
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: The Chancellor has asked the splendidly named Office of Tax Simplification to consider how exemptions from capital gains tax could be reformed or scrapped.

item.title: This season jump suits make the leap from sofa-slouching to sophisticated
item.description: Jess Wood shared her advice for embracing this summer's trend for all-in-ones. The British style expert explained slinky, tea suit shapes are perfect for garden drinks on a balmy evening.

item.title: Mexico releases new report that shows more than 73,000 people are missing
item.description: New government data found that 73,201 people are missing in Mexico, mostly a result of the constant violence between rival criminal organizations.

item.title: Stores are offering one-to-one shopping experiences - in your own home
item.description: Jess Wood gives her verdict on online styling services offered by John Lewis, Selfridges, Topshop, Reiss and Stitch Fix. British style expert says most struggled to show full length outfits.

item.title: Simone Biles stuns fans with behind-the-scenes tumbling pass
item.description: Biles, 23, took to Twitter on Tuesday to share a video of herself doing a difficult tumbling pass, writing: 'Haven't done a double tuck since I was probably 13.'

item.title: BEN FOGLE: It'll take FOUR months to take dog to EU post-Brexit
item.description: BEN FOGLE, pictured with pet dog Storm setting off for a family holiday in Austria, is calling for the government to take action and ensure European travel for pets continues to be the norm.

item.title: Paul Ainsworth slams diners for not turning up to reservations
item.description: Paul Ainsworth, well-known as a guest on BBC's Saturday Kitchen, today took to social media to slam 27 diners for failing to turn up after booking a seat his pub The Mariners, in Rock, Cornwall.

item.title: GoPro for beetles: Researchers create a tiny robotic camera backpack
item.description: Researchers at the University of Washington developed the tiny wireless steerable camera which streams video to a smartphone and has a range of 60 degrees.

item.title: Amber Heard LIED to US immigration about her PA, says ex-aide
item.description: Kate James, who was fired by Amber Heard in February 2015, made the claim in a witness statement made as part of Johnny Depp's High Court libel case against The Sun newspaper.

item.title: Elephant rescued after landing upside down in a pit in India
item.description: The large animal fell flat on its back in the ditch in West Bengal and was unable to get up by itself.

item.title: Jealous dog reacts badly to owner for kissing boyfriend
item.description: Owner Steffi Ledbetter, 26, can be heard asking dachshund-chihuahua Ginger whether it's ok to kiss her boyfriend Anthony. But the dog barks when she leans in for a kiss in Florida.

item.title: Priti Patel's GIANT mug causes a stir on Twitter
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel has caused a frenzy on Twitter as she was pictured drinking out of an enormous mug during the Home Affairs Committee remote hearing today.

item.title: British ISIS bride lost an arm and a breast in Syria bombing
item.description: Samia Hussein, a 25-year-old from Southall, west London, blamed ISIS for the loss of her arm. She said the caliphate put women and children at risk by storing supplies next to houses filled with families.

item.title: Jihadis jailed in the Middle East 'should be allowed BACK to their homelands', says report
item.description: A paper backed by ex-FBI agent Ali Soufan is urging Western nations including Britain to 'reconsider their stance on repatriation and bring home their citizens' jailed in Syria, Iraq and Turkey.

item.title: Priti Patel to mount a crackdown on foreign criminals after loopholes let 2,000 dodge deportation
item.description: The number of serious offenders deported from Britain has dropped by almost 40 per cent in the past four years with Home Secretary Priti Patel (inset) ready to mount crackdown on foreign criminals.
